title: A retentiue, to stay good Christians, in true faith and religion, against the motiues of Richard Bristow Also a discouerie of the daungerous rocke of the popish Church, commended by Nicholas Sander D. of Diuinitie. Done by VVilliam Fulke Doctor of diuinitie, and Maister of Pembroke hall in Cambridge.
author: Fulke, William, 1538-1589.
publisher: By Thomas Vautroullier for George Bishop,
notes: A reply to "A briefe treatise of diverse plaine and sure wayes to finde out the truthe in this time of heresie" (commonly known as the Motives) by Richard Bristow, and "The rocke of the Churche" by Nicholas Sander.
Leaf V7 contains Vautrollier's printer's mark; the last leaf is blank.
Reproduction of the original in the Union Theological Seminary (New York, N.Y.). Library.
